010package imagingbook.lib.util;
011
012import java.io.File;
013import java.io.FileOutputStream;
014import java.io.IOException;
015import java.io.InputStream;
016import java.net.URI;
017import java.net.URISyntaxException;
018import java.net.URL;
019import java.net.URLClassLoader;
020import java.util.jar.Manifest;
021
022
023/**
024 * This class defines various static methods for managing
025 * file-based resources and JAR manifest files.
026 * 
027 * @author W. Burger
028 */
029public abstract class FileUtils {
030
031        /**
032         * Removes the extension part of a pathname.
033         * Examples:<br>
034         * "foo.txt" &rarr; "foo",
035         * "foo" &rarr; "foo",
036         * "foo." &rarr; "foo.",
037         * ".txt" &rarr; ".txt".
038         * @param name the pathname
039         * @return the pathname without the extension (if valid)
040         */
041        public static String stripFileExtension(String name) {
042                int dotInd = name.lastIndexOf('.');
043                // if dot is in the first position,
044                // we are dealing with a hidden file rather than an DefaultFileExtension
045                return (dotInd > 0) ? name.substring(0, dotInd) : name;
046        }
047        
048        /**
049         * Extracts the extension part of a pathname as a string.
050         * Examples:<br>
051         * "foo.txt" &rarr; "txt",
052         * "foo" &rarr; "",
053         * "foo." &rarr; "",
054         * ".txt" &rarr; "".
055         * @param name the pathname
056         * @return the extension or an empty string
057         */
058        public static String getFileExtension(String name) {
059                int dotInd = name.lastIndexOf('.');
060                return (dotInd > 0) ? name.substring(dotInd + 1) : "";
061        }
062        
063        // ----  resources-related stuff ----------------------------------
064        
065        /**
066         * Find the path from which a given class was loaded.
067         * @param clazz a class.
068         * @return the path of the .class file for the given class or null (e.g.
069         * if the class is anonymous).
070         */
071        public static String getClassPath(Class<?> clazz) {
072                String path = null;
073                try {
074                        URI uri = clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().toURI();
075                        if (uri != null && !uri.getPath().isEmpty()) {
076                                path = new File(uri).getCanonicalPath();
077                        }
078                } catch (URISyntaxException | IOException e) { }
079                return path;
080        }
081        
082//      public static String getClassPath(Class<?> clazz) {
083//              return clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().getFile();
084//              //return clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().toString();
085//      }
086        
087        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
088
089        /**
090         * Lists (to System.out) the paths where classes are loaded from.
091         */
092        public static void printClassPath() {
093                ClassLoader cl = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();
094                URL[] urls = ((URLClassLoader) cl).getURLs();
095                for (URL url : urls) {
096                        System.out.println(url.getPath());
097                }
098        }
099        
100        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
101        
102        /**
103         * Checks 'by name' if a particular class exists.
104         * 
105         * @param classname fully qualified name of the class, e.g. {@literal imagingbook.lib.util.FileUtils}
106         * @return {@code true} if the class was found, {@code false} otherwise
107         */
108        public static boolean checkClass(String classname) {
109                // String logStr = "  checking class " + classname + " ... ";
110                try {
111                        if (Class.forName(classname) != null) {
112                                // IJ.log(logStr + "OK");
113                                return true;
114                        }
115                } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) { }
116                // IJ.log(logStr + "ERROR");
117                return false;
118        }
119        
120        
121        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
122        
123        // from https://bukkit.org/threads/extracting-file-from-jar.16962/
124        /**
125         * Reads all data from the given input stream and copies them
126         * to to a file.
127         * @param in the input stream
128         * @param file the output file
129         * @throws IOException if anything goes wrong
130         */
131        public static void copyToFile(InputStream in, File file) throws IOException {
132                FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(file);
133                try {
134                        byte[] buf = new byte[1024];
135                        int i = 0;
136                        while ((i = in.read(buf)) != -1) {
137                                out.write(buf, 0, i);
138                        }
139                } catch (IOException e) {
140                        throw e;
141                } finally {
142                        if (in != null) {
143                                in.close();
144                        }
145                        if (out != null) {
146                                out.close();
147                        }
148                }
149        }
150        
151        
152        
153        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
154        
155        /**
156         * Finds the manifest (from META-INF/MANIFEST.MF) of the JAR file
157         * from which {@literal clazz} was loaded.
158         * 
159         * See: http://stackoverflow.com/a/1273432
160         * @param clazz A class in the JAR file of interest.
161         * @return A {@link Manifest} object or {@literal null} if {@literal clazz}
162         * was not loaded from a JAR file.
163         */
164        public static Manifest getJarManifest(Class<?> clazz) {
165                String className = clazz.getSimpleName() + ".class";            
166                String classPath = clazz.getResource(className).toString();
167                //IJ.log("classPath = " + classPath);
168                if (!classPath.startsWith("jar")) { // Class not from JAR
169                  return null;
170                }
171                String manifestPath = classPath.substring(0, classPath.lastIndexOf("!") + 1) + "/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF";
172                Manifest manifest = null;
173                try {
174                        manifest = new Manifest(new URL(manifestPath).openStream());
175                } catch (IOException ignore) { }
176                return manifest;
177        }
178        
179        
180        // ----------------------------------------------------
181        
182        
183        public static void main(String[] args) {
184                String fileName = ".txt";
185                System.out.println("name = " + fileName);
186                System.out.println("stripped = " + stripFileExtension(fileName));
187                System.out.println("ext = " + getFileExtension(fileName));
188                System.out.println(getClassPath(FileUtils.class));
189        }
190        
191
192}
